grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 枕籍【チンセキ】bedding, bed, to sleep together in the same bed, to sleep together using each other's bodies as pillow, to sleep together using books as a pillow
開枕【カイチン】bringing out the pillows and futon (in Zen Buddhism), sleeping
陶枕【トウチン】porcelain pillow (used in summer)
kun reading compounds: 枕【まくら】pillow, bolster, introduction (e.g. to a rakugo story), lead-in
